trans-unit.source: Creates a control that generates a list of items in a bulleted format.

In this topic: - [Introduction](#Introduction) - [Accessibility](#Accessibility) - [Declarative Syntax](#DeclarativeSyntax) ## Introduction Use the BulletedList control to create a list of items that are formatted with bullets.

To specify the individual list items that you want to appear in a BulletedList control, place a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> object for each entry between the opening and closing tags of the BulletedList control.

To specify the bullet type to use to display list items in a BulletedList control, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.BulletStyle%2A> property to one of the bullet types that are defined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle> enumeration.
The following table lists the available bullet styles.

|Bullet style|Description| |------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|Not set.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A number.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A lowercase letter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|An uppercase letter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A lowercase Roman numeral.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|An uppercase Roman numeral.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A filled circle.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|An empty circle.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A filled square.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A custom image.| Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.FirstBulletNumber%2A> property to specify the value that starts the numbering of list items in an ordered BulletedList control.

The value that is assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.FirstBulletNumber%2A> property is ignored, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.BulletStyle%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle> field.

If you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.BulletStyle%2A> property to the value of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle> to specify a custom image for the bullet, you must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.BulletImageUrl%2A> property also to specify the location of the image file.

To specify the display behavior of the list items in a BulletedList, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.DisplayMode%2A> property to one of the values that are defined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode> enumeration.

The defined display behaviors are <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode>.
When a hyperlink is clicked, it navigates to a URL.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property to specify the URL that a hyperlink navigates to.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Target%2A> property to specify the frame or window that displays the Web page that is navigated to when a hyperlink is clicked.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.DisplayMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode>, the BulletedList control displays list items as links that post back to the server when clicked.
To programmatically control the actions that are performed when a link button is clicked, provide an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Click> event.

Note that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.SelectedIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.SelectedItem%2A> properties are inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class and are not applicable to the BulletedList control.
Use the event data of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs> class to determine the index of the link button in a BulletedList that was clicked.
The BulletedList control also supports data binding.
To bind the BulletedList to a data source, you can use any of the provided data-binding mechanisms.
For more information, see [Binding to Databases](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/ab7b2846-975b-4057-a948-45527497c742).
## Accessibility The markup rendered by default for this control might not conform to accessibility standards such as the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0 (WCAG) priority 1 guidelines.
For details about accessibility support for this control, see [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Declarative Syntax ```              ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> class.
Use the BulletedList constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> class.
Adds the HTML attributes and styles for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control to render to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.

The AddAttributesToRender method is used primarily by control developers to insert the appropriate attributes and styles into the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter?displayProperty=fullName> output stream for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Gets or sets the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.AutoPostBack*> property for the base class.
The AutoPostBack property is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
Do not assign a value to the AutoPostBack property.
If you do assign a value to the AutoPostBack, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception is thrown.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
An attempt was made to assign a value to the AutoPostBack.
Gets or sets the path to an image to display for each bullet in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
The path to an image to display as each bullet in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref>.
Gets or sets the bullet style for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle> property to specify the bullet style to apply to the list items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle> property is set using one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle> enumeration values.
The following table lists the possible values.

|Bullet style|Description| |------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|Not set.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A number.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A lowercase letter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|An uppercase letter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A lowercase Roman numeral.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|An uppercase Roman numeral.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A filled circle.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|An empty circle.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A filled square.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>|A custom image.| Specifying the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle> value allows you to supply your own image for the bullet.

If you specify the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle> value, you must also set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.BulletImageUrl%2A> property to the URL of the custom image to use.

> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control does not support the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.AlternateText%2A> property because the bullets are inherently decorative and do not provide additional information that needs to be conveyed via assistive technology.

However, if you want to use a custom image to convey a concept to the user, you should add additional text to each of the bulleted list items or use a control that allows you to specify alternate text for each image.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle"></xref>.
The specified type is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle"></xref> values.
Occurs when a link button in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control is clicked.
The Click event is raised when a list item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control is clicked.

To enable list items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control to raise the Click event, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.DisplayMode%2A> property first must be set to the value <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode>.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
To be added.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> collection for the control.
The Controls property is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
The Controls collection is overridden from the base class to always return the <xref:System.Web.UI.EmptyControlCollection> collection.
A control collection for the control.
Gets or sets the display mode of the list content in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
Use the DisplayMode property to specify the display behavior to apply to the content of list items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
The DisplayMode property is set using one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode> enumeration values.
The following table lists the possible values.

|Value|Displayed as| |-----------|------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode>|Text.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode>|Hyperlinks.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode>|Link buttons.| The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode> value allows you to display list content as hyperlinks.
When clicked, a hyperlink navigates to a URL.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property to specify the URL that a hyperlink navigates to.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode> field allows you to display list content as links.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Click?displayProperty=fullName> event to post back to the server when a link button is clicked.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode"></xref>.
The specified type is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the value that starts the numbering of list items in an ordered <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
Use the FirstBulletNumber property to specify the value that starts the numbering of list items in an ordered <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.

The value that is assigned to the FirstBulletNumber property is ignored, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.BulletStyle%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle> values.
Although the value of the FirstBulletNumber property is an integer, it does not always cause a bullet to render as a number.

For example, if you set the FirstBulletNumber property to `4` and set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.BulletStyle%2A> property to the value <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle>, the first bullet number will render as a lowercase d.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The value that starts the numbering of list items in an ordered <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
The default is `1`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Click"></xref> event for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Click> event is raised when a list item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control is clicked.

To enable list items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control to raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Click> event, you must first set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.DisplayMode%2A> property to the value <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode>.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
The OnClick method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises events for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control when a form is posted back to the server.
The RaisePostBackEvent method is used internally by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control when a link button within the item list is clicked.

The containing page specifies the index of the clicked link button in the `eventArgument` parameter, which is used to initialize the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs.Index%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs> object.

The RaisePostBackEvent method raises a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Click> event by passing the initialized <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.OnClick%2A> method.
The RaisePostBackEvent method optionally can perform validation before raising the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Click> event for the control.

To validate a group of controls on the page when a link button within the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> is clicked, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.CausesValidation%2A> property to `true` and specify the group of controls to be validated in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.ValidationGroup%2A> property.
The string representation for the index of the list item that raised the event.
Writes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control content to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object for display on the client.
The Render method is used primarily by control developers.
The Render method writes the rendered content of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> items to the client using the supplied <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object.
Each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> item is represented by an element in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control is empty, no content is rendered to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter>.

If there is at least one list item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection, the Render method writes the HTML content for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.RenderBeginTag%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.RenderContents%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.RenderEndTag%2A> methods.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Renders the bulleted text for each list item in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.

The RenderBulletText method renders the bulleted text for each list item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control using the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.DisplayMode%2A> property.
A collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> objects in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref>.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> to retrieve from the collection.
The output stream that renders HTML content to the client.
Renders the list items of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control as bullets into the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref>.
This method renders the list items of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control as bullets into the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter?displayProperty=fullName>.
This method is used primarily by control developers.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control is rendered if the data source has no data or if the control is not data-bound.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control is rendered if the data source has no data or if the control is not data-bound; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
In the base class, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndex%2A> property returns a zero-based index of the currently selected item.
The default is -1, which indicates that nothing is selected.
The SelectedIndex property is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
**Note** When you use the `get` accessor for the SelectedIndex property, it always returns `-1`.
An attempt to use the `set` accessor for the SelectedIndex property raises a <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.

Use the event data of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs> class to determine the index of the link button in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control that was clicked.
This property is not bindable in visual designers, but is bindable at runtime.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.BindableAttribute>.
Always returns -1.
An attempt was made to assign a value to the SelectedIndex.
Gets the currently selected item in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.

In the base class, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedItem%2A> property returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> object that represents the currently selected item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
The default is `null`.
The SelectedItem property is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
> [!NOTE] > If you use the `get` accessor for the SelectedItem property to return the selected item for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control, it always returns `null`.
Use the event data of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs> class to determine the index of the link button in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> that was clicked.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value*> property of the selected <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
The SelectedValue property is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
> [!NOTE] > The SelectedValue property is set internally based on the selected list item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
If you set the SelectedValue property directly, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception is thrown.
This property is not bindable in visual designers, but is bindable at runtime.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.BindableAttribute>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value*> of the selected <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref>; otherwise, an empty string (""), if no item is selected.
An attempt was made to assign a value to the SelectedValue.
For a description of this method, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> interface.
A string that represents an optional event argument to pass to the event handler.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> value for the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
Use the TagKey property to determine the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag> value that is associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
The TagKey property is used primarily by control developers.
The HTML text writer tag value.

Gets or sets the target window or frame in which to display the Web page content that is linked to when a hyperlink in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control is clicked.
Values must begin with a letter in the range of A through Z (case-insensitive), except for the special values that are listed in the following table, which begin with an underscore.

|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |`_blank`|Renders the content in a new window without frames.| |`_parent`|Renders the content in the immediate frame-set parent.| |`_search`|Renders the content in the search pane.| |`_self`|Renders the content in the frame with focus.| |`_top`|Renders the content in the full window without frames.| > [!NOTE] > Check your browser documentation to determine if the `_search` value is supported.
For example, Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0 and later support the `_search` target value.
Use the Target property to specify the frame or window that displays the Web page that is linked to when a hyperlink in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control is clicked.

To display the content of the list items as hyperlinks in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode> property to the value <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListDisplayMode>.
Then, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property of each list item to the URL of the Web page to navigate to.
If the Target property is not set, the browser or window with focus refreshes when the hyperlink is clicked.
> [!NOTE] > The Target property renders as a `target` attribute.
The `target` attribute on `anchor` elements is not allowed in the XHTML 1.1 document type definition.
Do not set the Target property if the rendered output for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> must be XHTML 1.1 compliant.
For more information, refer to the topic [XHTML Standards in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> > When creating accessible Web pages, it is strongly recommended you avoid using the Target property to target another window.
For more information, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The target window or frame in which to load the Web page linked to when a hyperlink in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> is clicked.
The default is an empty string ("").
Gets or sets the text for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
The Text property is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
> [!NOTE] > The Text property is set internally based on the selected list item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
If you set the Text property directly, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception is thrown.

While you cannot access the Text property of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control, you can use the event data of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs> class to determine the index of the link button in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> that was clicked.
You can then access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton.Text%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedValue*> of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref>, if one of the items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> is selected; otherwise, an empty string ("").
An attempt was made to assign a value to the Text.
